intro: Euphrasia vulgaris, commonly known as the common eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in moist, grassy habitats. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent, showy eyespots that resemble the human eye, giving it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and often branched. Euphrasia vulgaris is known for its medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies for eye conditions.
